message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is primarily focused on natural language processing (NLP) and deep learning techniques for text classification tasks, specifically for the Hindi language. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the use of different deep learning architectures like CNN, LSTM, and Attention, which are commonly used in machine learning and deep learning research, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper evaluates the effectiveness of multilingual pre-trained sentence embeddings based on BERT and LASER, which are popular techniques in the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the challenges of working with low-resource languages, which could fall under the sub-categories of information retrieval (cs.IR) and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE).
